pageContext.claim: “[Iran has] a minus 25% GSP, which nobody ever heard of before. ”
pageContext.analysis: We have no idea where Trump got this figure but he appears to have misplaced a decimal point. The United Nations projected in January Iran's GDP would decline 2.7 percent in 2020 -- not 27 percent as Trump claims. After the coronavirus pandemic affected the worldwide economy, the International Monetary Fund projected a 6 percent decline in real GDP. Other reports suggest a decline as much as 11 percent. But that is still not close to 27 percent.
